Title: Les Misérables
Summary: "Les Misérables" is a monumental novel by Victor Hugo, set in early 19th-century France. It tells the story of Jean Valjean, a former convict who spends his life seeking redemption for his past crimes. His journey intertwines with the lives of characters like Fantine, a destitute single mother; Cosette, her innocent daughter; and Javert, a relentless police inspector. The narrative explores themes of social injustice, morality, and love. Amid the backdrop of significant historical events, such as the Battle of Waterloo and the 1832 Paris Uprising, Hugo presents a profound critique of French society's treatment of the poor and marginalized.
